text: <@U1PSHT5C4> -san. Just copy git cloned "<http://github.com/hyperledger/fabric|github.com/hyperledger/fabric>" should work. (Actually it's working in my environment).
<@U1PSHT5C4>:   what do you mean by "local" chaincode?

<@U1PSHT5C4>: you don’t need the entire fabric repo to be vendored in your chaincode project. It doesn’t need to be vendored at all. What you do need is to have the core/chaincode/shim package in your $GOPATH to build your chaincode binary. You can accomplish this by cloning the gerrit repo into your $GOPATH until we have set up a means to tell go get how to resolve into Gerrit.
also, you might want to start using the fabric-chaintool - it’s actually pretty cool
until we have the docs hosted by LF, you can find the latest here <http://cbf-fabric-docs.readthedocs.io/en/latest/Setup/Chaincode-setup/#running-the-chaincode>
